task.winefoxs_spellbooks.casting_task.de: Little maid will use Iron's Spells to attack enemy
task.winefoxs_spellbooks.casting_task.co: Spell book in main hand or bauble inventory
task.winefoxs_spellbooks.magic_support_t: Little maid will use Iron's Spells to support master
Spell book in main hand or bauble inventory
config.winefoxs_spellbooks.max_mana_mult: maximum mana multiplier based on player (Default: 1)
config.winefoxs_spellbooks.show_chat_bub: Show chat bubbles in battle (Default: true)
config.winefoxs_spellbooks.melee_attack_: Allow maid use melee attack in magic attack task (Default: true)
Maid start casting range every spell id (override default)
Extra spell cause effect registry (spell id => effect id)
This command must be executed by a player or use /wsb summon <target>
commands.winefoxs_spellbooks.wsb.cast.fa: %d targets are not IMagicEntity or failed to cast
patchouli.touhou_little_maid.book.catego: Winefox's Spellbooks is an addon for Iron's Spells and Spellbooks, adding spellcasting tasks for maids
patchouli.touhou_little_maid.book.entrie: This is a crossover mod designed for Touhou Little Maid and Iron's Spells and Spellbooks, aiming to expand the magical combat capabilities of maids in Touhou Little Maid. By integrating with Iron's Spells and Spellbooks, maids can equip spellbooks as accessories and use various powerful magic attacks and summoning skills in battle.

Just like players, mana is the key to maid spellcasting. Different types and levels of spells require different amounts of mana to cast. Equipping staves and mage armor can increase the maximum mana cap.$(br)Maid mana regeneration rate is affected by mana regeneration attributes (not yet implemented). By default, it regenerates 2%% per second. Additionally, if a maid has been struck by lightning, the mana regeneration rate will be upgraded to 100%% every 0.5s.

Spellbooks are the medium for maid spellcasting. Maids cannot use spell scrolls to cast spells. Spellbooks must be equipped in the maid's accessory slot to take effect.$(br)In addition to regular spellbooks, weapons and equipment imbued with spells can also be used as casting media.

This mod adds two new tasks for maids: Magic Attack and Magic Support.$(br)In Magic Attack mode, the maid will actively cast spells to attack hostile mobs. If she has a melee weapon and is close enough to the enemy, she will also use melee attacks.$(br)In Magic Support mode, the maid will not actively attack enemies, but instead try to heal nearby injured masters and allied creatures (including maids with the same master), or provide buffs to allies and debuffs to enemies.

Spells are classified into seven categories: Attack, Defense, Movement, Recovery, Positive Effect, Negative Effect, and Reinforcement. These can be configured via config files and datapacks. Built-in addon support: Cataclysm: Spellbooks, SnackPirate's Aeromancy Additions, Discerning The Eldritch, Ender's Spells and Stuff: Requiem, Fire's Ender Expansion, GTBC's Spellbooks, Magic From The East, Snow Waifu Spell, Hazen 'N Stuff, Dreamless Spells

This mod adapts casting animations for GeckoLib maid models. Model pack authors can create an animation/<packname>.iss.animation.json file to implement custom animations. For reference on default animation key names, see this file: $(l:https://github.com/TartaricAcid/TouhouLittleMaid/blob/1.21/src/main/resources/assets/touhou_little_maid/animation/iss.animation.json)Click to open$(/l)

Summon Maid is an Ender school spell that summons temporary maid combat units. Summoned maids randomly receive models, equipment, and spells, and automatically perform attack or support tasks.$(br)Maids come in three loadouts: Warrior, Mage, and Support, each with different equipment and spell combinations. Higher spell levels summon more maids with stronger equipment and spells.$(br)Maids have a chance to ride brooms for aerial combat, circling around targets while casting spells.$(br)Duration is 10 minutes. You can also use the /wsb summon command to customize summoning.

Summoned maid loadouts are fully datapack-driven, located at data/<namespace>/summoned_maid_loadouts/<name>.json.$(br)Each loadout file can define weight, model filter, broom mode, and tiered equipment and spell pools based on summon level.$(br)Weapons and armor are referenced via item tags, spells via spell tags, all supporting weighted randomization and roll count ranges.$(br)See the default loadout files warrior.json, mage.json, and support.json for reference.
